content: garter chevron blanket this eye-catching blanket is knitted in lovely squishy garter stitch there are 2 sizes the larger one shown here in rainbow colours is suitable for a cot or throw the smaller shown in pink/mauve/grey for a stroller but it can easily be made smaller or larger by adding/subtracting pattern repeats or row the first and last stitch of each wrong side row is slipped purlwise this gives a neat edge that lines up with the stripes this pattern is suitable for inexperienced knitters increases are made by knitting into the back and front of the loop kfb decreases by knitting 2 stitches together size small 70 x 45 cm 28 x 17 5 large 110 x 70 cm 43 x 28 © catherine anderson designs garter chevron blanket v2 1 needles 4 5mm 80cm circular needles yarn knit picks mighty stitch 80% acrylic 20% wool main colour mc cream contrast colours large size cc serrano orange conch canary alfalfa macaw sky celestial eggplant contrast colours small size blush wisteria silver for the small size you should allow 60m 66yds of yarn per contrast colour stripe and 30m 33yds per main colour stripe for the large size allow 95m 104yds per contrast colour stripe and 45m 50yds per main colour stripe yarn substitutions note that if you substitute a different yarn you may need a different quantity if you expect your blanket to be in everyday use i suggest you use a yarn that can be machine washed notions darning needle gauge 19 stitches = 10cm 4 in garter stitch using 4 5mm needles gauge is probably not critical for this project but it is important in ensuring the finished article is the right size and it also affects the quantity of yarn needed construction the blanket is knitted flat abbreviations k knit sl1p slip 1 stitch purlwise holding yarn in front kfb knit into the front loop as usual but don t drop it off the needle then knit into the back of the loop and drop it off the needle 1 stitch increased k2tog knit 2 stitches together 1 stitch decreased instructions small size using mc cast on 142 stitches row 1 rs k1 *k9 k2tog k8 kfb* repeat from * to * 6 more times k1 row 2 ws sl1p with yarn in front *k9 k2tog k8 kfb* repeat from * to * 6 more times yarn forward sl1p repeat row 1 and 2 three more times 8 row knitted © catherine anderson designs garter chevron blanket v2 2 change to cc1 and repeat row 1 and 2 nine times 18 row knitted change to mc and repeat row 1 and 2 four times 8 row knitted repeat these 24 row another six times changing the contrast colour each time you should have 7 contrast colour and 8 main colour stripes large size using mc cast on 182 stitches row 1 rs k1 *k9 k2tog k8 kfb* repeat from * to * 8 more times
